meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or denoting a nucleophile.
meanings.sent1: The chemist studied the nucleophilic behavior of the molecule.
meanings.sent2: The nucleophilic atom eagerly bonded with the positively charged ion.
meanings.sent3: The nucleophilic reaction was so enthusiastic, it high-fived the other atoms.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a nucleophilic force, drawing people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The nucleophilic nature of the compound made it stand out in the experiment.

meanings.definition: Having an affinity for nuclei or positively charged atoms.
meanings.sent1: The nucleophilic substance was attracted to the positively charged nucleus.
meanings.sent2: His nucleophilic tendencies made him popular among the protons.
meanings.sent3: The nucleophilic magnet seemed to have a crush on the positively charged particles.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity was like a nucleophilic bond with inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The nucleophilic attraction between them was undeniable and electric.
